summary: This document is an email chain between the U.S. Marshals Service (USMS) and the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) regarding a Touhy request from the Government of the U.S. Virgin Islands (GVI) for information about Jeffrey Epstein. It discusses the coordination of a response to this request and references a prior FOIA disclosure about Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.role: Deceased subject of FOIA and Touhy requests
persons.context: The central subject of the FOIA request previously released by the USMS and the new Touhy request from the GVI seeking information for a potential civil matter.

persons.name: KAF
persons.context: The author of the emails, coordinating the response to the GVI's Touhy request regarding Jeffrey Epstein and informing the USANYS of these developments.

events.title: USMS FOIA Disclosure on Epstein
events.description: The U.S. Marshals Service released material in response to a FOIA request related to Jeffrey Epstein and informed the USANYS about it.

events.title: GVI Touhy Request for Epstein Information
events.description: The Government of the U.S. Virgin Islands submitted a Touhy request to the DOJ's Office of Justice Programs and SMART Office, seeking information about Jeffrey Epstein for potential use in a civil matter. The request was forwarded to the USMS for response.

keyFacts: The U.S. Marshals Service had previously released material about Jeffrey Epstein in response to a FOIA request in September 2019.
The Government of the U.S. Virgin Islands (GVI) submitted a Touhy request in April 2020 for information about Epstein for a potential civil matter.
The USMS is coordinating a response to the GVI's Touhy request with the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Virgin Islands.
The USMS informed the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) about these developments to ensure coordinated responses if needed.
The correspondence mentions the impact of the COVID-19 pandemic on the NYC/NJ area.
